etymology.description: 馬(馬) (mǎ, "horse") + 爻(爻) (yáo, "marks") = horse with marks -> mixed
etymology.interpretation: The character 駁(bó, "mixed") combines the semantic element 馬(馬) (mǎ, "horse"), suggesting the concept related to horses, with the phonetic 爻(爻) (yáo, "marks") to convey the idea of a horse with mixed or different colors or marks, figuratively indicating something mixed or mottled.
